pullRequest.body:
We prove that the successor of an element is the infimum of those greater than it, both in a complete lattice and a conditionally complete lattice with no maxima.

---

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10449243067/job/28931162465)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
maintainer merge
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

If `a` is maximal, then `succ âŠ¤ = âŠ¤ = sInf âˆ… = sInf (Ioi âŠ¤) = sInf (Ioi a)`
```suggestion
theorem succ_eq_csInf [ConditionallyCompleteLattice Î±] [SuccOrder Î±] (a : Î±) :
```

There's two theorems in that sequence I can't find:
1. `IsMax a â†’ IsTop a` for conditionally complete lattices
2. `IsMax a â†’ sInf Ã˜ = a`

Any idea if we have them? If not, I can add them in this PR.
`IsMax.isTop`

Actually, I don't believe 2 is provable. All lemmas in the definition of a conditionally complete lattice assume that the set is nonempty. 

It makes sense, I guess. Every nonempty subset bounded below has an infimum, that doesn't say anything about the infimum of the empty set!
Hmm yeah
Can you keep `succ_eq_iInf` around?

Is it really necessary? This is just `succ_eq_sInf` composed with [`sInf_eq_iInf`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/CompleteLattice.html#sInf_eq_iInf). It's definitely a less natural result.
Wait, we don't seem to have the conditionally complete version of that? That's probably what we should be fixing instead.

> Wait, we don't seem to have the conditionally complete version of that? That's probably what we should be fixing instead.

Yeah, because it's false. Nested conditional `iInf`s don't behave the way you expect.

> It's definitely a less natural result.

Maybe, but it's more practical when interfacing with the `iInf` API

`succ_eq_ciInf` is not true in general, and requires that the infimum be less than `sInf Ã˜`. Here's what the new proof of `succ_eq_iInf` looks like:
```lean 4
theorem succ_eq_iInf [CompleteLattice Î±] [SuccOrder Î±] (a : Î±) : succ a = â¨… (b) (_ : a < b), b := by
  rw [succ_eq_sInf, iInf_subtype', iInf, Subtype.range_coe_subtype]
  rfl
```
Again, I feel like it's a bit dumb to have this, and if we must, why not `â¨… b âˆˆ Set.Iio a, b` instead? I'll add it if you really want it, but I personally don't get it.

I mean, consider lemmas like `le_iInfâ‚‚`. `succ_eq_sInf` would be annoying to interface with it.

> why not `â¨… b âˆˆ Set.Iio a, b` instead

because it's not simp normal form

Does this work now?
```suggestion
theorem succ_eq_iInf [CompleteLattice Î±] [SuccOrder Î±] (a : Î±) : succ a = â¨… b > a, b := by
```
It does! That honestly kinda justifies having these lemmas at all for me.

```suggestion
theorem pred_eq_iSup [CompleteLattice Î±] [PredOrder Î±] (a : Î±) : pred a = â¨† b < a, b :=
  succ_eq_iInf (Î± := Î±áµ’áµˆ) _
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/SuccPred/Basic): `succ_eq_sInf`
